body.p: To his Excellency Thos. E. Bramlett Gov of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Your Petitioner Charles Gullitt Respectfully States that at the November Term 1865 of the Magoffin Circuit Court he was fined $70, for selling whiskey, says the whiskey for which he was fined. was sold during the late Rebellion when the Country was infested with a armed men who wielded things in their own way and a refusal would be early punishment, Says that he is a very poor man & has a family who are wholly dependent upon his daily labor for a sustenance; and that it will bring Misery upon himself & family if he is forced to pay said fine. he therefore appeals to Your highness and asks that said fine be remitted & that all persons be restrained & prohibited from the collection of the same
We the undersigned Join in prayer with said Petitioner and ask that said fines be remitted and that all persons be Restrained from collecting the same

November 30th 1865
